title: cu admin identifies 2 molesters
body: the administration of chittagong university yesterday claimed to have identified two persons who sexually assaulted a female student on the campus on sunday night.

title: rohingya genocide case to proceed
body: the world court yesterday rejected myanmar’s objections to a genocide case over its treatment of the muslim rohingya minority, paving the way for the case to be heard in full.

title: need 1 week to assess situation
body: admitting that the power division could not impose schedule-wise power cuts across the country, state minister for power, energy and mineral resources nasrul hamid yesterday sought one week’s time to address the issue.

title: wasfia 1st bangladeshi to conquer k2
body: renowned bangladeshi mountaineer wasfia nazreen conquered the treacherous k2 in pakistan, becoming the first person from bangladesh to summit the second-tallest mountain in the world.

title: cu sexual assault: fingers pointed at bcl men
body: those who sexually assaulted a female student on chittagong university campus on july 17 night are members of bangladesh chhatra league, said police sources and cu bcl insiders.

title: noab hikes newspaper price by tk 2 from jul 25
body: all newspapers owned by the members of newspaper owners’ association of bangladesh (noab) will see a price increase of at least tk 2 per issue from july 25.

title: yet-to-start mega projects: consider putting them on hold
body: given the current economic situation, the government should consider suspending mega projects the physical work of which has yet to begin, economist debapriya bhattacharya said yesterday.

title: ‘you cannot remain silent’
body: the high court yesterday came down hard on bangladesh railway for mismanagement, ticket scalping and carrying passengers on the train roofs.

title: rajapaksa ally elected lanka president
body: six-time prime minister ranil wickremesinghe was elected as crisis-wracked sri lanka’s new president by the country’s parliament yesterday, with the backing of the party of the ex-leader -- who fled abroad after his palace was stormed by protesters.

title: electricity crisis may worsen
body: the government’s plan for one to two hours of daily power cuts is failing, especially in the north, and the signs are that the electricity crisis may worsen across the country in the coming days.

title: ec’s dialogue hits a snag as bnp skips it
body: the bnp yesterday skipped election commission’s dialogue seeking recommendations of political parties on how to hold a free and fair general election.

title: imf’s $4.5b loan: govt now has cold feet
body: the government is stalling on taking the $4.5 billion loan from the international monetary fund to ease the pressure on the foreign currency reserves after seeing the conditions that would be attached.

title: road crash claims six more lives
body: a toddler, her mother, and aunt were among six people who died after a bus rammed into an auto-rickshaw in bakerganj, barishal, yesterday afternoon.

title: parties can’t be forced to join nat’l polls: cec
body: chief election commissioner kazi habibul awal yesterday said it’s not possible to force any political party to take part in the next national election.

title: bangladesh getting gsp plus: rights situation, labour law have to improve
body: the european parliamentary committee on international trade has categorically said bangladesh needs to improve rights situation and amend labour law at the soonest in compliance with international standards to be eligible for gsp plus.

title: capacity charge for power: tk 16,785cr paid in 9 months
body: the government paid tk 16,785 crore in capacity charges to power plants in the first nine months of the last fiscal year for 22,118mw daily power generation capacity.

title: ensure austerity in all spheres
body: prime minister sheikh hasina has again urged all, including the stakeholders in public and private sectors, to maintain austerity in power consumption and other areas amid a rise in global inflation.

title: inflation at 9-year high
body: inflation raced to a nine-year high of 7.56 percent in june, in a development that lays bare the extent of the cost of living crisis gripping the low-income and middle-class people in bangladesh thanks to a war taking place some 5,800 kilometres away in ukraine.

title: economic jitters felt by stock market
body: the jitters surrounding the state of the economy are reverberating on the stock market, with the key index dropping for the fifth day in a row.

title: foreign stock investors keep pulling out funds
body: foreign investors pulled more money out of the stock market in the first four months of fiscal year (fy) 2025-26, as political uncertainty made them cautious about putting fresh funds into shares.

title: farmers of early potato varieties hit by old stock glut
body: farmers who cultivated early varieties of potatoes are once again incurring losses as prices of newly harvested tubers remain unusually low due to an oversupply of older stock in the market.

title: govt’s treasury bill borrowing up 4.3% in nov
body: the government increased its borrowing through short-term treasury bills in november, issuing tk 31,289.13 crore worth of the instruments, a 4.3 percent rise from october, according to data from bangladesh bank (bb).

title: ctg customs’ jul-nov revenue jumps 9% but misses target
body: chattogram customs house, the country’s largest revenue-collecting entity, posted a 9 percent year-on-year rise in revenue in the first five months of the current fiscal year, but still fell short of its target.

title: nearly half of bangladeshis remain offline: bbs
body: nearly half of the population of bangladesh is still without internet access, according to the latest official data, a situation that it professionals describe as disappointing when compared with neighbouring countries.

title: prime bank clients to get discounts on jbs holdings’ flats
body: mamur ahmed, senior executive vice-president and head of branch distribution at prime bank plc, and abdul huque, managing director of jbs holdings limited, signed an agreement

title: nrbc bank organises ai-driven aml & cft conference
body: md mofizur rahman khan chowdhury, executive director of bangladesh bank and acting head of the bangladesh financial intelligence unit (bfiu), attended as the chief guest

title: ai boom drives data-center dealmaking to record high, says report
body: interest in data centers has swelled this year as tech giants and ai hyperscalers have planned billions of dollars in spending to scale up infrastructure

title: afc to launch nations league competition
body: the asian football confederation said on sunday it will launch a nations league contest in a bid to improve competition standards and commercial opportunities for national teams across the continent.

title: pressure on morocco to deliver as africa cup of nations kicks off
body: morocco carry a huge weight of expectation into their opening game at the africa cup of nations on sunday as the hosts, with star man achraf hakimi returning from injury, aim to see off stiff competition to claim continental glory.

title: cummins, lyon doubts for melbourne after 'hugely satsfying' ashes
body: elated australia skipper pat cummins sunday said retaining the ashes after just three tests was "hugely satisfying" and vowed no let up in melbourne while casting doubt on whether he and nathan lyon would play.

title: arteta tells leaders arsenal to 'learn' while winning
body: arsenal boss mikel arteta said his side have to learn to kill games off while they are winning after reclaiming top spot in the premier league with a 1-0 win at everton.

title: west indies 43-0, need 419 more to win after conway joins elite
body: the west indies were 43-0 at stumps sunday on the fourth day of the third test against new zealand, needing a further 419 to win, after devon conway became just the 10th player in test history to hit a double century and a century in the same match.

title: full fixtures of bpl 12
body: the first phase of the tournament will be held in sylhet, where 24 matches will be played over six matchdays, concluding on january 2, 2026.

title: 'it sucks': stokes vows england will bounce back after losing ashes
body: skipper ben stokes said sunday it "sucks" to lose the ashes inside 11 days but vowed england would bounce back as a more consistent side in the final two tests in melbourne and sydney.

title: conway joins elite club with century, double ton in same test
body: conway's 327 runs so far are the third highest for new zealand in a single test, behind stephen fleming's 343 (274 and 69) against sri lanka in 2003, and martin crowe's 329 (30 and 299) against sri lanka in 1991.

title: mbappe equals ronaldo’s 59-goal mark in real madrid win over sevilla
body: "to do like cristiano did, my idol, the best player in real madrid's history and a world great, it's an honour for me," said mbappe, who turned 27 on saturday.

title: ‘this group will provide exciting cricketers’
body: bangladesh face a tough group a alongside five-time champions india, new zealand and the usa in the icc under-19 world cup, running from january 15 to february 8.

title: preparations gather pace as bpl 12 nears
body: despite the relatively subdued atmosphere, franchises have shifted into high gear ahead of the tournament opener, with newcomers rajshahi warriors leading the early preparations.

title: what to watch
body: apart from the fifth day’s action of the third ashes test, the english premier league match and the new zealand–west indies test, spectators can also watch india take on arch-rivals pakistan in the under-19 asia cup final at the icc academy in dubai today.

title: liverpool sink nine-man spurs but isak limps off after rare goal
body: alexander isak endured a bittersweet evening as the liverpool striker scored before limping off injured in a chaotic 2-1 win over nine-man tottenham on saturday.

title: thiago silva signs for porto
body: former chelsea and paris saint-germain defender thiago silva has signed for porto at the age of 41, the portuguese club announced on saturday.

title: haaland sends man city top, chelsea fightback frustrates newcastle
body: erling haaland fired manchester city to the top of the premier league by beating west ham 3-0, while chelsea fought back to salvage a 2-2 draw at newcastle on saturday.

title: fifa best xi 'a joke', rages flick over raphinha snub
body: barcelona coach hansi flick raged against raphinha's omission from fifa's team of the year, labelling the world football governing body's 'the best men's xi' a joke on saturday.

title: bpl sylhet phase tickets to go on sale sunday
body: the bangladesh cricket board (bcb) announced on saturday that match tickets for the sylhet phase of the upcoming bangladesh premier league (bpl) will go on sale on sunday.

title: bcb expresses solidarity with the daily star, prothom alo
body: the bangladesh cricket board (bcb) on saturday strongly condemned the acts of violence and damage inflicted on the offices of the daily star and prothom alo in dhaka.

title: hridoy pays tribute to osman hadi
body: bangladesh batter tawhid hridoy paid an emotional tribute to sharif osman hadi following the latter’s burial on saturday, remembering the inqilab moncho spokesperson and frontline figure of the july uprising through a heartfelt facebook post.

title: the press under fire, and the cost of mistaking destruction for change
body: the image of a burnt copy of the daily star, dated victory day, is difficult to shake off. it stays with you long after you scroll past it on your social media newsfeed—not because it is dramatic, but because of what it reveals.

title: hadi’s death will haunt us forever
body: in july 2024, we, the gen-z, stepped into the streets, frightened yet resolute, wounded yet unwilling to break, because we believed bangladesh could be rewired around dignity.

title: bauls, ballots, and the price of weak institutions
body: the surest sign of a liberal democracy is not a flag, nor a constitution framed behind glass. it is the quiet competence of institutions—and the political culture that keeps them honest. one shapes the other the way a river shapes its banks, and the banks, in turn, discipline the river.

title: phulbari coal, power crisis, and a dangerous revisionism
body: regarding the phulbari open-pit coal mining project, the chief adviser's press secretary recently made a facebook post suggesting that bangladesh is facing a severe power crisis because coal at phulbari was not extracted.

title: outcome of cop30 does not bode well for climate diplomacy
body: the 30th conference of the parties (cop30) to the un framework convention on climate change (unfccc) produced a lacklustre outcome by any measure, as reflected in many post-cop analyses. this remains significant because cop outcomes continue to shape the direction, pace, and credibility of global climate diplomacy, even when they fall short.

title: how data science can shape our financial future
body: "data is the new oil," a truth the world has embraced, but bangladesh is still learning to harness its potential. from banks predicting loan defaults to democratising access to healthcare through telemedicine and health apps, the scope of data science across socio-economic and public sectors is vast.

title: rajuk’s short-sighted dap puts millions at risk in a major quake
body: unplanned urbanisation, violations of the national building code and the detailed area plan (dap), and rampant filling of wetlands with sand for housing projects have made dhaka the riskiest city in the country.

title: the nuisance of distorting begum rokeya’s legacy
body: when i first heard about the desecration of roquiah sakhawat hossain, popularly known as begum rokeya, at dhaka university in the aftermath of the july uprising,

title: oc in trouble for demanding biriyani, sweets
body: shayestaganj oc accused of demanding food items worth over tk 10 lakh from 3 companies to entertain guests invited on the occasion of police day and durga puja

title: water scarcity hampers jute processing
body: high yield of jute fails to make farmers in faridpur happy as they are facing huge trouble to rot and process raw jute in absence of adequate water in local water bodies (beels), canals and ponds.

title: auto rice mill near school
body: an influential quarter is setting up an auto rice mill close to a government primary school at atharodana in ghatail upazila, ignoring local people’s objection.

title: ramshackle ratnai bridge: an impediment of development
body: economic activities in four upazilas including three in kurigram district and one in lalmonirhat could not gain the momentum as desired despite the inauguration of the sheikh hasina dharla bridge over the dharla river in 2018.

title: sudden jamuna erosion makes many homeless
body: sudden erosion by the jamuna river has devoured several homesteads and vast farmlands within a few hours at mazzan village in sirajganj’s shahzadpur upazila last week, creating panic among the villagers.

title: natore up member found dead, wife injured
body: police recovered the body of a local union parishad (up) member from his second wife’s house at joanpur in naldanga upazila early yesterday.

title: permanent shops on leased land!
body: violating rules and without taking permission from the authorities concerned a local influential man has been constructing permanent shops after taking lease of a rural market at dhalapara in ghatail upazila.

title: illegal pond: a threat to surrounding cropland
body: a local awami league (al) leader has dug a pond illegally posing threats to the surrounding cropland and homesteads. an act that he has done after failing to buy the villagers’ land at a cheap rate, locals said.

title: payra erosion threatens barguna villages
body: thousands of villagers in barguna’s taltali and amtali upazilas are worried about losing their belongings to continuous erosion of payra river. the erosion has taken a serious turn recently posing threats to six villages in the upazilas.

title: robot chishti: a magical reality
body: a twelve-grader student has invented a robot surprising everyone in the village. ahsan habib, 18, of kaliganj upazila in lalmonirhat has named it ‘chishti.’

title: allowance too scanty to survive
body: sukhobala sen, 90, has been receiving old age allowance of tk 500 for eight years but she can hardly afford to buy her prescribed medications for a week with the meagre amount of money.

title: farmers forced to sell paddy at low price
body: bikas mandol of sikdermollic village in pirojpur sadar upazila cultivated boro paddy on his one bigha land spending over tk 20,000, which he took on credit from different people and ngos.

title: passed yet not passed
body: a freedom fighter’s aspirations to become a lawyer were muffled as he was shown failed in the llb examination by the rajshahi university authorities. but at last the indomitable spirit of the freedom fighter prevailed as he obtained the certificate after a 13-year-long legal battle with the university authorities.

title: weaving baskets to stay afloat
body: rural basket makers in chapainawabganj are spending busy hours as the baskets are now in high demand for packaging mangoes of the district, one of the largest producers of quality mangoes in the country.

title: what farmers gained
body: dear readers, we all know countries across the world are now facing challenges of inflation arising from the ukraine-russia war. it is hurting the global economy.

title: faridpur bus terminal: a nightmare for passengers
body: faridpur municipal bus terminal has turned out to be a nightmare for both the passengers and transport workers due to lack of renovation works for a long time. a little to moderate rains flood the entire bus terminal causing immense sufferings.

title: short term govt project: a boon for stone crushers
body: a total of 1681 male and female workers from impoverished families of lalmonirhat’s patgram upazila are happy getting an opportunity to work under the government 40-day job creation project. prior to joining the project, they were involved in risky stone crushing jobs.

title: blame game extends sufferings
body: patients, doctors and staffers of faridpur general hospital have to tolerate the obnoxious stench of untreated wastes dumped in the open sky as faridpur municipality authority has stopped collecting wastes for two months.

title: bangladesh tops south asia in air pollution
body: a new world bank report has ranked bangladesh as south asia’s worst-hit country by air pollution, with 100 percent of schoolchildren in dhaka and nearby areas exposed to unsafe levels of fine particulate matter (pm2.5).

title: the tussock’s tale …
body: a tussock moth caterpillar, adorned with jewel-like dew drops, grips a blade of grass on a cold winter morning in the gumai beel.

title: 690 climate-resilient low-cost homes launched in four cities
body: the project, implemented by the local government division with support from the uk government and undp, was inaugurated virtually from the secretariat yesterday

title: major japan quake leaves 30 injured
body: pm takaichi said 30 people were injured in the quake which triggered tsunami waves up to 70 centimetres (28 inches) high

title: butterfly fair: a day of colours at ju
body: the zahir raihan auditorium premises at jahangirnagar university turned vibrant yesterday as a daylong butterfly fair brought together hundreds of butterflies, vivid photographs, and nature enthusiasts.

title: our reef at risk
body: a discarded fishing net clings to a coral in the bay of bengal off saint martin's island, posing a grave threat to its survival. beneath these waters, abandoned nets have become deadly traps, entangling coral colonies across the seabed.

title: cyclone ditwah: maritime ports advised to hoist signal 2
body: the cyclone over southwest bay of bengal and adjoining coastal sri lanka moved northwards over southwest bay of bengal and adjoining tamil nadu coast

title: benazir’s immovable properties: court appoints administrators to look after them
body: a dhaka court yesterday appointed administrators to look after some of the immovable properties of benazir ahmed and his family members.

title: bsf seizes ‘record’ 41.49 kg gold near benapole border
body: the indian border security force yesterday seized 41.49kg gold worth rs 21.22 crore from five bags left behind by suspected smugglers near benapole, reportedly the biggest gold haul by indian security forces along the indo-bangladesh border.

title: 2 covid patients die; positivity rate 8.36
body: two patients with covid-19 died and at least 620 new covid-19 cases were recorded by the health directorate in the 24 hours till 8:00am yesterday.

title: bangladeshis highest number of irregular migrants to italy
body: bangladeshis were found to be the highest number of irregular migrants reaching the shores of italy in the first six months of this year.

title: bsf seizes ‘record’ 41.49 kg gold near benapole border
body: the indian border security force yesterday seized 41.49kg gold worth rs 21.22 crore from five bags left behind by suspected smugglers near benapole, reportedly the biggest gold haul by indian security forces along the indo-bangladesh border.

title: 10 injured as bnp, police clash in tangail
body: at least 10 people, including policemen, were hurt in a clash between law enforcers and local bnp leaders in baghil area of dhanbari, tangail, yesterday.

title: sohan captain for zim t20is
body: the bangladesh cricket board (bcb) yesterday named 28-year-old wicketkeeper-batter nurul hasan sohan captain for the t20i series in zimbabwe after deciding to rest regular skipper mahmudullah riyad for the t20is.

title: grain exports via black sea: ukraine, russia sign deal
body: russia and ukraine yesterday signed a landmark deal to reopen ukrainian black sea ports for grain exports, raising hopes that an international food crisis aggravated by the russian invasion can be eased.

title: lanka troops raid main protest camp
body: sri lankan security forces raided and partially cleared the main protest camp occupying government grounds in colombo early yesterday, fuelling fears that president ranil wickremesinghe had launched a crackdown a day after being sworn in.

title: murmu elected india’s 15th president
body: droupadi murmu was elected india’s 15th president yesterday with the backing of the ruling party, making her the first person from a marginalised community to occupy the top post.

title: media employees bill: make it journo friendly
body: leaders of different journalist organisations yesterday demanded the government bring several changes to the mass media employees (services conditions) bill-2022, including dropping the provision of setting up mass media court, to make the proposed law journalist friendly.

title: uk pm contenders squabble over tax as campaign kicks off
body: liz truss, the favourite to become britain’s next prime minister, yesterday criticised rival rishi sunak over his tax policies while finance minister as the pair kicked off six weeks of campaigning.

title: italian pm resigns
body: italian prime minister mario draghi resigned yesterday after his national unity government fell apart, setting the country on course for an early election and hitting financial markets.

title: 2 ministries ask officials to cut energy expenses
body: the finance ministry yesterday directed government officials to lower fuel and lubricant expenditures for their vehicles by 20 percent while the public administration ministry asked officials not to waste power.

title: ‘like a morning after a nuclear attack’
body: a world bank team that visited different areas of war-torn bangladesh in june 1971 likened kushtia to a bombed-out “wwii german town”.

title: fear of sexual harassment triggering child marriage: survey
body: a recent survey by plan international bangladesh found that fear of sexual harassment and social exclusion are the major reasons behind parents marrying off their daughter at an early age.

title: for the love of tea
body: my baby boy snatches my empty tea mug from me and starts licking it. he was given the last few drops of tea from the mug and now he wants more. he puts his hand inside the mug, gets the boiled tea dust into his fist, inserts them in his mouth and starts chewing furiously.

title: sc forms committee against sexual harassment
body: the supreme court administration has formed a five-member committee to receive complaints of sexual harassment on court premises, conduct inquiry into them and make necessary recommendations to this effect.

title: uk-listed cybersecurity firm avast in merger talks with nortonlifelock
body: london-listed cybersecurity firm avast is in advanced talks with us rival nortonlifelock inc about a merger that would create a clear leader in consumer security software.

title: change is the only constant
body: eight years ago, i saw a small ad in the friday magazine of the daily star which changed the course of my life—for better or worse.

title: the last hustle
body: the soft light of the setting sun illuminates the entire section every time i walk in, mostly because i am always late. on one side white balloons hang, on another side a dart board.

title: media: between a rock and a hard place
body: 2019 has not been a comfortable year for the media globally. while nobody has yet tallied up the numbers internationally, 7,200 jobs were lost just in the u.s., according to the business and finance news organisation business insider’s own calculation.

title: why we need weekend magazines
body: so it has finally happened. hard as it is to accept it, the star weekend magazine is about to close the curtain after an impressive run of 23 years.

title: how new autocrats curb press freedom
body: as democratic backsliding has become a global phenomenon and hybrid regimes—a political system which has both democratic and authoritarian traits—have proliferated, freedom of the press has come under threat all around the world.

title: the future is censored
body: ignoring the concerns of journalists and rights defenders, the digital security act was passed in the parliament on september 19, 2019. it is known both at home and abroad to be draconian, antithetical to freedom of speech and democracy.

title: (uncertain) future of journalism in bangladesh
body: when we talk about changes in the media eco-system, we do not only talk about the medium but also the content, business models, and ethical practice of journalism. media organisations that used to control both content and channels now only produce content;

title: “predisposed journalism can never grow and sustain”
body: under your editorship, we got two leading newspapers in bangladesh—bhorer kagoj and prothom alo. how did you plan the content of these newspapers, and their editorial structure and policy? how did you make them stand out in a market already occupied by several age-old, reputed newspapers?

title: putting the “news” in our news feeds
body: roshni islam, 23, is a student of environmental science at independent university, bangladesh (iub). on a typical day in her life, she wakes up around 8am and goes through a rotation of social media apps on her phone.

title: media under surveillance capitalism
body: yes, our world has entered into a new phase of rule which can be termed as surveillance capitalism, at home as well as on a global scale. shoshana zuboff, the author of the age of surveillance capitalism writes, “at its core, surveillance capitalism is parasitic and self-referential.

title: social media and fake news: the beginning of the end?
body: when the internet came, media outlets were faced with two contrasting choices: provide a web version for people to read content freely or risk descending into irrelevance.

title: selfies of old school media
body: the first time i reported professionally was in 1973 covering the ducsu elections. i was excited, but i nearly got whacked when two political activists mistook me for an activist—long beard, long hair, long chador etc.—and chased me. i just kept moving as they shouted, “what are you doing here when others are gone?”

title: four stories
body: at star weekend, we try to find and frame the stories around us. stories of strife and injustice and joy and history. this week, in what feels like a penultimate time, we decided to explore some of the stories that exist within.

title: 2026 world cup draw: breaking down groups, top contenders and their roadmap
body: for the first time in history, the world’s biggest football event will be hosted by three north american countries -- the united states, canada, and mexico -- with 48 teams participating.

title: bpl 12: a reset or just a replay?
body: will this season finally move past the controversies that have haunted previous editions -- or is the bpl headed for another cycle of backlash?

title: inside the making of a centurion: bashar on mushfiqur’s character and commitment
body: former bangladesh captain habibul bashar sumon, the man who placed the first test cap on an 18-year-old mushfiqur rahim at lord’s in 2005, reflects on the veteran wicketkeeper-batter’s remarkable journey. having witnessed mushfiqur’s evolution both as a teammate and later as a selector, bashar offers rare insight into the highs and lows that shaped bangladesh’s first cricketer to reach the milestone of 100 tests.

title: when will women athletes get safe space in bangladesh?
body: former bangladesh women’s cricket team captain jahanara alam’s recent allegations of sexual harassment have sparked widespread discussion in the country’s sporting community. while women athletes in bangladesh continue to face various forms of harassment, many remain hesitant to speak out -- largely due to the absence of a secure and supportive environment.

title: how will the interim govt tackle the discontent in administration?
body: this episode, hosted by tanim ahmed and featuring journalist bahram khan of the daily star, discusses the impact of successive contract-based appointments in the administration and their political context

title: bangladesh cricket: is the old culture of interference back?
body: bcb president aminul islam bulbul has stated that he will “intervene” from the ireland series onwards to improve the team’s performance.

title: khadijatul kubra, once imprisoned in dsa case, to contest in jnucsu polls
body: khadijatul kubra, a student of jagannath university, who spent 15 months in prison in a now-repealed digital security act, 2018, is contesting in the jagannath university central students' union (jnucsu) elections
